perturbation.original_text:
5.01     TERM.  The  term  ("Term")  of  this Agreement shall be for one hundred
eighty  days  (180)  from  the  date set forth below unless Network 1 or Visa or
MasterCard  or Harris Bank doesn't approve Affiliate's ISO application, in which
case,  the  Term  will  be  3 years. This Agreement will automatically renew for
successive  one-year  terms  unless  terminated by either party by providing the
other  with  30  days  written notice that this Agreement will not be renewed or
Affiliate  enters  into  a  Processing  agreement  with  Network  1  and  an ISO
Sponsorship  agreement  with  Harris  Bank  in  which  case  this Agreement will
automatically  terminate  concurrent  with  the  execution  of  such agreements.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.01     TERM.  The  term  ("Term")  of  this Agreement shall be for one hundred
eighty  days  (180)  from  the  date set forth below unless Network 1 or Visa or
MasterCard  or Harris Bank doesn't approve Affiliate's ISO application, in which
case,  the  Term  will  be  3 years. This Agreement will automatically renew for
successive  one-year  terms  unless  terminated by either party by providing the
other  with  30  days  written notice that this Agreement will not be renewed or
Affiliate  enters  into  a  Processing  agreement  with  Network  1  and  an ISO
Sponsorship  agreement  with  Harris  Bank  in  which  case  this Agreement will
automatically  terminate  concurrent  with  the  execution  of  such agreements. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Network 1 reserves the right to terminate this agreement at any time with no notice period.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating the contract renews for one-year terms with 30 days' notice, but also gives Network 1 the right to terminate at any time with no notice. This creates uncertainty about the actual term and termination conditions.

perturbation.original_text:
3.02     PAYMENT.  The  Affiliate's Fee payable pursuant to this agreement shall
be  payable  as  outlined in Exhibit A. All payments to Affiliate are subject to
Network  1  receipt  of all amounts payable to Network 1 by the Member Bank with
respect  to the transaction giving rise to Affiliate's Fee. Network 1 shall have
no  liability  with  respect  to  the  payment  of such Affiliate's Fee (for any
specific  Merchant)  under  Section 3.01  [AMOUNT] unless and until Network 1 receives the
above  referenced  payment for Merchant.  In the event Merchant rejects fees for
any  reason,  the  fees  due to Affiliate shall not be due and only payable upon
Network 1's receipt of such payment. Payments will be made on or before the 25th
of  each  calendar  month.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.02     PAYMENT.  The  Affiliate's Fee payable pursuant to this agreement shall
be  payable  as  outlined in Exhibit A. All payments to Affiliate are subject to
Network  1  receipt  of all amounts payable to Network 1 by the Member Bank with
respect  to the transaction giving rise to Affiliate's Fee. Network 1 shall have
no  liability  with  respect  to  the  payment  of such Affiliate's Fee (for any
specific  Merchant)  under  Section 3.01  [AMOUNT] unless and until Network 1 receives the
above  referenced  payment for Merchant.  In the event Merchant rejects fees for
any  reason,  the  fees  due to Affiliate shall not be due and only payable upon
Network 1's receipt of such payment. Payments will be made on or before the 25th
of  each  calendar  month. However, in no event shall Network 1 be obligated to pay the Affiliate more than 50% of the Affiliate's Fee, regardless of the amount received from the Member Bank.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation creates a direct conflict. It states payments are dependent on Network 1 receiving funds from the Member Bank, but then limits Affiliate's Fee to 50% of the agreed amount. This creates uncertainty about the actual payment amount and conditions.

perturbation.original_text:
8.05     GOVERNING  LAW.  All  disputes  or  claims  by  Payment  Data  Systems
hereunder  shall be resolved by arbitration in McLean, Virginia, pursuant to the
rules of the American Arbitration Association. All disputes or claims by NETWORK
1  hereunder shall be resolved by arbitration in San Antonio, Texas, pursuant to
the  rules  of  the  American  Arbitration  Association.
8.06     ARBITRATION.  All  disputes  or  claims  hereunder shall be resolved by
arbitration  in  McLean,  Virginia,  pursuant  to  the  rules  of  the  American
Arbitration  Association.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.05     GOVERNING  LAW.  All  disputes  or  claims  by  Payment  Data  Systems
hereunder  shall be resolved by arbitration in McLean, Virginia, pursuant to the
rules of the American Arbitration Association. All disputes or claims by NETWORK
1  hereunder shall be resolved by arbitration in San Antonio, Texas, pursuant to
the  rules  of  the  American  Arbitration  Association.
8.06     ARBITRATION.  All  disputes  or  claims  hereunder shall be resolved by
arbitration  in  McLean,  Virginia,  pursuant  to  the  rules  of  the  American
Arbitration  Association. Notwithstanding the above, Network 1 shall have the sole right to choose the jurisdiction for any dispute resolution.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces conflicting clauses. Section 8.05 specifies the location for arbitration depending on which party initiates the dispute, while section 8.06 contradicts this by stating all arbitrations should be in McLean, Virginia. A third sentence is added that introduces additional uncertainty granting Network 1 the unilateral right to choose the jurisdiction for any dispute, overriding the previous clauses.
